<div data-component="mdc-c-module-wrapper" data-module-theme="dark" data-module-background="deep-blue" data-module-category="" data-module-gradient-position="top-right" class="mck-o-edge-to-edge SectionHeader_mck-c-section-header___N7qG mck-c-module-wrapper"><style></style><div data-component="mdc-c-background-image" class="mdc-c-bg-image___GJdv1_990311c background-image-section-header-504D12242A2F43F69A9B7A2FCD76378C-bg SectionHeader_mck-c-section-header__parallax-container__sgMMy" style="transform: translate(0px, 0px);"></div><div class="mdc-c-bg-image___GJdv1_990311c mdc-c-bg-image--opaque-bg___CauU1_990311c" style="opacity:0.2"></div><div class="mck-o-container"><div class="mck-o-container--wrapped mck-o-container--mobile-spacing"><div id="section-header-6" class="mdc-u-grid mdc-u-grid-col-lg-12 SectionHeader_mck-c-section-header__wrapper__CZEyB"><div class="mdc-u-grid-col-lg-start-2 mdc-u-grid-col-lg-end-12 SectionHeader_mck-c-section-header__wrapper-positioned__fIWpF"><div class="mdc-u-grid mdc-u-grid-gutter-sm SectionHeader_mck-c-section-header__wrapper-text__hSx1f" style="display: none; opacity: 0;"><h2 data-component="mdc-c-heading" class="mdc-c-heading___0fM1W_990311c SectionHeader_mck-c-section-header__heading__2ePOu"><span>6. Delivering a win-win future</span></h2></div><div class="SectionHeader_mck-c-section-header__section-holder__BaLti"></div></div></div></div></div></div>
<p>Productivity is a hot-button issue for economies navigating particularly turbulent times. Indeed, accelerating productivity growth may be the only route out of current financial stress, reconfiguring global trade patterns, and shifts in companies’ manufacturing and services footprint to build resilience that delivers rising wealth and robust growth in GDP and incomes.<span class="FootNote_footnote-holder__tjRqy"><a aria-label="footnote" href="javascript:void(0);" class="FootNote_footnote-wrapper__AIRwL undefined FootNote_inactive__VZfCp" aria-describedby="b3708c81-181a-45b5-a634-f9554664635e"><sup class="FootNote_footnotesup__e73z_">56</sup><span class="FootNote_notch-wrapper__b_5NS"><span class="FootNote_notch__omKtY"></span></span><span class="FootNote_tooltip__QtrbA mdc-u-mt-2"><span class="FootNote_footnote-content__r2OVl"><span id="b3708c81-181a-45b5-a634-f9554664635e" aria-hidden="true" data-module-theme="light" class="FootNote_footnote-text__VjKgO mck-u-links-inline"><em><a href="/mgi/overview/the-future-of-wealth-and-growth-hangs-in-the-balance">The future of wealth and growth hangs in the balance</a></em>, McKinsey Global Institute, May 2023.</span></span></span></a></span></p>
<p>This research indicates that narrowing the MSME productivity gap with large companies can yield considerable value, and that large companies, policy makers, and MSMEs themselves can contribute to capturing that value by acquiring key competencies. </p>
<p>Improving the productivity of small businesses merits immediate attention. It may be a self-resolving issue—a natural progression as employment shifts to larger enterprises as economies develop. As discussed, this progression can play out in different ways. Some MSMEs may scale into larger companies, others may be acquired by larger enterprises, and some may cease operations and make room for new businesses. Indeed, previous MGI research suggests that high-growth emerging economies tend to be the ones where large companies are allowed to scale rapidly.<span class="FootNote_footnote-holder__tjRqy"><a aria-label="footnote" href="javascript:void(0);" class="FootNote_footnote-wrapper__AIRwL undefined FootNote_inactive__VZfCp" aria-describedby="28db6f60-4b08-4cc3-aaad-792fd0e7292e"><sup class="FootNote_footnotesup__e73z_">57</sup><span class="FootNote_notch-wrapper__b_5NS"><span class="FootNote_notch__omKtY"></span></span><span class="FootNote_tooltip__QtrbA mdc-u-mt-2"><span class="FootNote_footnote-content__r2OVl"><span id="28db6f60-4b08-4cc3-aaad-792fd0e7292e" aria-hidden="true" data-module-theme="light" class="FootNote_footnote-text__VjKgO mck-u-links-inline"><em><a href="/featured-insights/innovation-and-growth/outperformers-high-growth-emerging-economies-and-the-companies-that-propel-them">Outperformers: High-growth emerging economies and the companies that propel them</a></em>, McKinsey Global Institute, September 2018.</span></span></span></a></span> However, the extent of this natural progression is limited. Even in the most advanced economies, MSMEs continue to contribute the majority of all workers employed by businesses. Change is also likely to be slow. The clear implication is that, overall, MSMEs will continue to play an important role in the long term, and that acting now to boost their productivity growth can make the difference to economy-wide growth.</p>
<p>But given the enormous variation in productivity performance evident at the subsector level and even among enterprises with different business models, getting the conditions right for raising productivity requires a microscopic view to help prioritize, design, and implement solutions.</p>
<h3>Three considerations can help shape stakeholder actions</h3>
<p>Even with an abundance of initiatives and examples of efforts that stakeholders can make, understanding how to capture the MSME productivity opportunity is a complex exercise. Opportunities vary a great deal on the ground, and there are few one-size-fits-all solutions. Intentional measures targeted at helping small enterprises may even raise questions about how this might affect the overall productivity of economies. We suggest three considerations for stakeholders as they develop their approaches. </p>
<h4>Creating a win-win economic fabric is important</h4>
<p>The global business landscape is deeply interconnected. The success or failure of large companies can have ripple effects throughout entire economic ecosystems. As such, stakeholders, including policy makers, regulatory bodies, associations, and large companies need to foster the right enabling conditions for the growth and prosperity of all enterprises. These conditions may require measures that go beyond conventional policies focused on MSMEs, such as facilitating access to credit for MSMEs and encouraging training for MSME employees. In addition to such measures, it may involve strategies to build “collective productivity.” </p>
<p>Strengthening networks and interactions between large and small businesses can yield productivity gains in the win-win domains and in domains where large companies outperform their peers but smaller ones lag behind. Where small businesses outperform while larger ones do not, there would be benefit in enabling those small enterprises to evolve into large ones or merge with them to promote business dynamism. When both large and small companies lag behind their peers, more fundamental steps to improve the economic fabric as a whole may be needed; for instance, investing in physical and digital infrastructure, establishing transparent and fair regulatory frameworks that boost competition, reducing trade barriers, and ensuring equal access to financial capital.</p>
<h4>Prioritization can pay off</h4>
<p>Stakeholders first need to decide which economic domains to focus on to make MSMEs more productive. Failing to prioritize which opportunities to pursue can lead to a dilution of efforts and place a burden on the often-limited resources at hand. Some countries have selected and supported “national champion” sectors, as has happened with beverage manufacturing in Italy, automotive manufacturing in Japan, and R&D in Israel. Such prioritization requires meticulous identification of the nation’s competitive advantages and a keen eye for demand trends, as well as allocating resources toward innovation, facilitating access to capital, and cultivating supportive networks.</p>
<h4>A granular and tailored approach matters</h4>
<p>Measures designed to help MSMEs improve their performance tend to be broad, but the granular lens of this research reveals that different subsectors have varied needs. Stakeholders may need to design a menu of measures for each prioritized opportunity.<span class="FootNote_footnote-holder__tjRqy"><a aria-label="footnote" href="javascript:void(0);" class="FootNote_footnote-wrapper__AIRwL undefined FootNote_inactive__VZfCp" aria-describedby="c16304df-3c76-43c1-880c-d973ff38aa28"><sup class="FootNote_footnotesup__e73z_">58</sup><span class="FootNote_notch-wrapper__b_5NS"><span class="FootNote_notch__omKtY"></span></span><span class="FootNote_tooltip__QtrbA mdc-u-mt-2"><span class="FootNote_footnote-content__r2OVl"><span id="c16304df-3c76-43c1-880c-d973ff38aa28" aria-hidden="true" data-module-theme="light" class="FootNote_footnote-text__VjKgO mck-u-links-inline">Abdulaziz Albaz, Marco Dondi, Tarek Rida, and Jörg Schubert, “<a href="/industries/public-sector/our-insights/unlocking-growth-in-small-and-medium-size-enterprises">Unlocking growth in small and medium-size enterprises</a>,” McKinsey & Company, July 2020.</span></span></span></a></span> In other words, taking a microscopic approach that reflects the dynamics of each subsector and country and that addresses barriers to productivity and scale in that context is warranted. </p>
<h3>All stakeholders can boost MSME competencies through a variety of proven approaches</h3>
<p>All stakeholders—policy makers, large companies, and MSMEs themselves—can adopt strategies designed to boost productivity, which may involve structural changes that go beyond traditional approaches. Policy makers can provide access to better infrastructure, while large companies can help MSMEs build scale-related competencies. MSMEs can collaborate with others to achieve network efficiencies.</p>
<h4>Policy makers can boost access to technology, new markets, and finance</h4>
<p>Supportive policy interventions can create advantages of scale for MSMEs and help overall business dynamism. The following three broad contributions stand out:</p>
<ul>
    <li><em>Being intentional in improving technology access and building management skills of businesses.</em> Singapore’s GoBusiness initiative provides financial support for all businesses that adopt technology solutions to improve their business processes, aligned to industry road maps.<span class="FootNote_footnote-holder__tjRqy"><a aria-label="footnote" href="javascript:void(0);" class="FootNote_footnote-wrapper__AIRwL undefined FootNote_inactive__VZfCp" aria-describedby="5124e62b-25f3-4a1e-a5bf-3905e9f4c078"><sup class="FootNote_footnotesup__e73z_">59</sup><span class="FootNote_notch-wrapper__b_5NS"><span class="FootNote_notch__omKtY"></span></span><span class="FootNote_tooltip__QtrbA mdc-u-mt-2"><span class="FootNote_footnote-content__r2OVl"><span id="5124e62b-25f3-4a1e-a5bf-3905e9f4c078" aria-hidden="true" data-module-theme="light" class="FootNote_footnote-text__VjKgO mck-u-links-inline"><em>Productivity solutions grant (PSG)</em>, GoBusiness, Singapore.</span></span></span></a></span> Governments can also make direct investments in digital infrastructure that help businesses expand their market reach. For example, in India, the Open Network for Digital Commerce aims to build an e-commerce platform, which can particularly assist small retailers reach new consumers because they lack the resources and financial capacity to develop their own platforms.<span class="FootNote_footnote-holder__tjRqy"><a aria-label="footnote" href="javascript:void(0);" class="FootNote_footnote-wrapper__AIRwL undefined FootNote_inactive__VZfCp" aria-describedby="c9440324-bfee-4564-b742-2e4d8ac8e365"><sup class="FootNote_footnotesup__e73z_">60</sup><span class="FootNote_notch-wrapper__b_5NS"><span class="FootNote_notch__omKtY"></span></span><span class="FootNote_tooltip__QtrbA mdc-u-mt-2"><span class="FootNote_footnote-content__r2OVl"><span id="c9440324-bfee-4564-b742-2e4d8ac8e365" aria-hidden="true" data-module-theme="light" class="FootNote_footnote-text__VjKgO mck-u-links-inline"><em>Democratising digital commerce in India: An open network for inclusive, competitive marketplaces</em>, Open Network for Digital Commerce,
    May 2023.</span></span></span></a></span> The Help to Grow program in the United Kingdom aims to help small businesses scale up by offering management courses taught by entrepreneurs and industry experts to develop leadership skills and establish business networks.<span class="FootNote_footnote-holder__tjRqy"><a aria-label="footnote" href="javascript:void(0);" class="FootNote_footnote-wrapper__AIRwL undefined FootNote_inactive__VZfCp" aria-describedby="cc52e0ab-46b2-4eeb-9e84-6a70c7a23743"><sup class="FootNote_footnotesup__e73z_">61</sup><span class="FootNote_notch-wrapper__b_5NS"><span class="FootNote_notch__omKtY"></span></span><span class="FootNote_tooltip__QtrbA mdc-u-mt-2"><span class="FootNote_footnote-content__r2OVl"><span id="cc52e0ab-46b2-4eeb-9e84-6a70c7a23743" aria-hidden="true" data-module-theme="light" class="FootNote_footnote-text__VjKgO mck-u-links-inline"><em>Help to scale-up and grow</em>, Gov.UK, February 2024.</span></span></span></a></span></li>
    <li><em>Opening up access to new markets.</em> One example is Europe’s “Small Business, Big World” initiative, which offers guidance on customs procedures, trade regulations, and market entry requirements in various countries to enable SMEs to expand their export activities.<span class="FootNote_footnote-holder__tjRqy"><a aria-label="footnote" href="javascript:void(0);" class="FootNote_footnote-wrapper__AIRwL undefined FootNote_inactive__VZfCp" aria-describedby="22bd3406-b48e-4a91-a416-1cafe5d771c8"><sup class="FootNote_footnotesup__e73z_">62</sup><span class="FootNote_notch-wrapper__b_5NS"><span class="FootNote_notch__omKtY"></span></span><span class="FootNote_tooltip__QtrbA mdc-u-mt-2"><span class="FootNote_footnote-content__r2OVl"><span id="22bd3406-b48e-4a91-a416-1cafe5d771c8" aria-hidden="true" data-module-theme="light" class="FootNote_footnote-text__VjKgO mck-u-links-inline"><em>Small business, big world</em>, European Economic and Social Committee, European Union, May 2012.</span></span></span></a></span> Canada’s CanExport program supports MSMEs in exploring new export opportunities, enabling them to participate in trade shows, conduct market research, and develop marketing materials for the international market.<span class="FootNote_footnote-holder__tjRqy"><a aria-label="footnote" href="javascript:void(0);" class="FootNote_footnote-wrapper__AIRwL undefined FootNote_inactive__VZfCp" aria-describedby="8bb9d6d9-ac36-426d-9bad-f2b7cded0063"><sup class="FootNote_footnotesup__e73z_">63</sup><span class="FootNote_notch-wrapper__b_5NS"><span class="FootNote_notch__omKtY"></span></span><span class="FootNote_tooltip__QtrbA mdc-u-mt-2"><span class="FootNote_footnote-content__r2OVl"><span id="8bb9d6d9-ac36-426d-9bad-f2b7cded0063" aria-hidden="true" data-module-theme="light" class="FootNote_footnote-text__VjKgO mck-u-links-inline"><em>CanExport funding for exporters, innovators, associations and communities</em>, Trade Commissioner Service, Government of Canada, February 2024.</span></span></span></a></span></li>
    <li><em>Boosting financial infrastructure that helps underfinanced MSMEs.</em> An open data framework, for instance, can enable financial institutions to use nontraditional data sources for credit underwriting, targeted at a range of underfinanced companies including MSMEs. An Experian study showed that including utility data allowed 20 percent of “thin-file” credit customers with scant documentation to support their credit application to become “thick-file” customers who have higher loan approval rates.<span class="FootNote_footnote-holder__tjRqy"><a aria-label="footnote" href="javascript:void(0);" class="FootNote_footnote-wrapper__AIRwL undefined FootNote_inactive__VZfCp" aria-describedby="8faacddc-150d-4b7d-9090-d1e5c19d4ca5"><sup class="FootNote_footnotesup__e73z_">64</sup><span class="FootNote_notch-wrapper__b_5NS"><span class="FootNote_notch__omKtY"></span></span><span class="FootNote_tooltip__QtrbA mdc-u-mt-2"><span class="FootNote_footnote-content__r2OVl"><span id="8faacddc-150d-4b7d-9090-d1e5c19d4ca5" aria-hidden="true" data-module-theme="light" class="FootNote_footnote-text__VjKgO mck-u-links-inline"><em>Let there be light: The impact of positive energy-utility reporting on consumers</em>, Experian, 2015.</span></span></span></a></span> For small businesses, this can increase access to financing, provide greater convenience, and improve product options.<span class="FootNote_footnote-holder__tjRqy"><a aria-label="footnote" href="javascript:void(0);" class="FootNote_footnote-wrapper__AIRwL undefined FootNote_inactive__VZfCp" aria-describedby="01749b4f-f782-4f8f-a49b-5b45025d2c5b"><sup class="FootNote_footnotesup__e73z_">65</sup><span class="FootNote_notch-wrapper__b_5NS"><span class="FootNote_notch__omKtY"></span></span><span class="FootNote_tooltip__QtrbA mdc-u-mt-2"><span class="FootNote_footnote-content__r2OVl"><span id="01749b4f-f782-4f8f-a49b-5b45025d2c5b" aria-hidden="true" data-module-theme="light" class="FootNote_footnote-text__VjKgO mck-u-links-inline"><em><a href="/industries/financial-services/our-insights/financial-data-unbound-the-value-of-open-data-for-individuals-and-institutions">Financial data unbound: The value of open data for individuals and institutions</a></em>, McKinsey Global Institute, June 2021.</span></span></span></a></span> Financial institutions could also benefit from efficiency improvements, better fraud prediction, and reduced friction and cost of data intermediation. Governments can also help businesses improve their working capital management by improving tax-related infrastructure and systems. In Latin America, countries such as Brazil, Chile, Colombia, and Peru have launched initiatives aimed at radically simplifying business registration and tax payment processes. One reform enabled businesses to formally register in a day.<span class="FootNote_footnote-holder__tjRqy"><a aria-label="footnote" href="javascript:void(0);" class="FootNote_footnote-wrapper__AIRwL undefined FootNote_inactive__VZfCp" aria-describedby="02f1848b-4a33-4366-8ce3-9cad7f3d5c65"><sup class="FootNote_footnotesup__e73z_">66</sup><span class="FootNote_notch-wrapper__b_5NS"><span class="FootNote_notch__omKtY"></span></span><span class="FootNote_tooltip__QtrbA mdc-u-mt-2"><span class="FootNote_footnote-content__r2OVl"><span id="02f1848b-4a33-4366-8ce3-9cad7f3d5c65" aria-hidden="true" data-module-theme="light" class="FootNote_footnote-text__VjKgO mck-u-links-inline">Regis Augusto Ely, Daniel de Abreu Pereira Uhr, and Júlia Gallego Ziero Uhr, “The impact of the individual microentrepreneur program on the Brazilian labor market,” <em>Economic Analysis of Law Review</em>, volume 10, number 2, May–August 2019; and <em>Tu empresa en un día</em>, Chilean Subsecretaría de Economía y Empresas de Menor Tamaño,
    July 26, 2023. </span></span></span></a></span></li>
</ul>
<p>In addition to these interventions, policy makers can also facilitate the availability of globally consistent yet granular data to enable all stakeholders to take a microscopic approach to understanding and thereby improving the productivity of MSMEs.</p>
<h4>Large companies can boost the competencies of MSMEs within their value chains </h4>
<p>As discussed earlier in this report, networks and linkages between MSMEs and large companies benefit the growth and performance of both. One study of small businesses in New York found that seven out of ten of them increased their revenue within two years of becoming part of a corporate supplier base.<span class="FootNote_footnote-holder__tjRqy"><a aria-label="footnote" href="javascript:void(0);" class="FootNote_footnote-wrapper__AIRwL undefined FootNote_inactive__VZfCp" aria-describedby="058b2864-c453-4e8b-b9fa-7aee6d0441c9"><sup class="FootNote_footnotesup__e73z_">67</sup><span class="FootNote_notch-wrapper__b_5NS"><span class="FootNote_notch__omKtY"></span></span><span class="FootNote_tooltip__QtrbA mdc-u-mt-2"><span class="FootNote_footnote-content__r2OVl"><span id="058b2864-c453-4e8b-b9fa-7aee6d0441c9" aria-hidden="true" data-module-theme="light" class="FootNote_footnote-text__VjKgO mck-u-links-inline"><em>Giving small firms the business</em>, Center for an Urban Future, 2011.</span></span></span></a></span> A 2023 study of Belgian companies found that when MSMEs started supplying superstar companies for the first time, their productivity increased by about 8 percent after four years. They also achieved an increase in sales to businesses other than the new superstar partner.<span class="FootNote_footnote-holder__tjRqy"><a aria-label="footnote" href="javascript:void(0);" class="FootNote_footnote-wrapper__AIRwL undefined FootNote_inactive__VZfCp" aria-describedby="439a27b8-9454-4943-b5ec-ad407ffbd63c"><sup class="FootNote_footnotesup__e73z_">68</sup><span class="FootNote_notch-wrapper__b_5NS"><span class="FootNote_notch__omKtY"></span></span><span class="FootNote_tooltip__QtrbA mdc-u-mt-2"><span class="FootNote_footnote-content__r2OVl"><span id="439a27b8-9454-4943-b5ec-ad407ffbd63c" aria-hidden="true" data-module-theme="light" class="FootNote_footnote-text__VjKgO mck-u-links-inline">Mary Amiti et al., <em>FDI and superstar spillovers: Evidence from firm-to-firm transactions</em>, National Bureau of Economic Research, working paper number 31128, October 2023. </span></span></span></a></span></p>
<p>But it is not a one-way street. As noted earlier, large companies also appear to benefit when their MSME partners and suppliers are more productive. This could be because large companies often depend on MSMEs in most parts of the value chain, from development to supply, production, service delivery, distribution, and sales and post-sales. For example, a large logistics player works with local delivery partners for last-mile delivery, and a small recruiting agency might help a large company fill key positions. Large companies therefore had an incentive to raise MSME capabilities. The following three ways are pivotal: </p>
<ul>
    <li><em>Assisting MSME partners to build digital and R&D capabilities.</em> Unilever’s open innovation platform Foundry connects its different divisions with startups to engage in joint ideation and mentorship opportunities, for instance.<span class="FootNote_footnote-holder__tjRqy"><a aria-label="footnote" href="javascript:void(0);" class="FootNote_footnote-wrapper__AIRwL undefined FootNote_inactive__VZfCp" aria-describedby="ac30145a-e04f-49ec-af0c-bd45d76715de"><sup class="FootNote_footnotesup__e73z_">69</sup><span class="FootNote_notch-wrapper__b_5NS"><span class="FootNote_notch__omKtY"></span></span><span class="FootNote_tooltip__QtrbA mdc-u-mt-2"><span class="FootNote_footnote-content__r2OVl"><span id="ac30145a-e04f-49ec-af0c-bd45d76715de" aria-hidden="true" data-module-theme="light" class="FootNote_footnote-text__VjKgO mck-u-links-inline">Shameen Prashantham, “The two ways for startups and corporations to partner,” <em>Harvard Business Review</em>, January 2019. </span></span></span></a></span> Google helps small businesses that purchase ad placements from it in gaining a deeper understanding of customer behavior and in improving the utilization and efficiency of ad spaces.<span class="FootNote_footnote-holder__tjRqy"><a aria-label="footnote" href="javascript:void(0);" class="FootNote_footnote-wrapper__AIRwL undefined FootNote_inactive__VZfCp" aria-describedby="6d483d12-3ab2-48c3-ac25-8d43ebb1c4a9"><sup class="FootNote_footnotesup__e73z_">70</sup><span class="FootNote_notch-wrapper__b_5NS"><span class="FootNote_notch__omKtY"></span></span><span class="FootNote_tooltip__QtrbA mdc-u-mt-2"><span class="FootNote_footnote-content__r2OVl"><span id="6d483d12-3ab2-48c3-ac25-8d43ebb1c4a9" aria-hidden="true" data-module-theme="light" class="FootNote_footnote-text__VjKgO mck-u-links-inline">Google for Small Businesses.</span></span></span></a></span> In India, Maruti Suzuki set up a “comprehensive excellence” program for its main MSME suppliers. In 2018–19, 50 percent of the company’s suppliers met the performance standards laid out and reported improved efficiency, more interest from investors, and broader access to procurement and R&D opportunities.<span class="FootNote_footnote-holder__tjRqy"><a aria-label="footnote" href="javascript:void(0);" class="FootNote_footnote-wrapper__AIRwL undefined FootNote_inactive__VZfCp" aria-describedby="48eac589-9446-4e42-b3df-8d45bad69ab7"><sup class="FootNote_footnotesup__e73z_">71</sup><span class="FootNote_notch-wrapper__b_5NS"><span class="FootNote_notch__omKtY"></span></span><span class="FootNote_tooltip__QtrbA mdc-u-mt-2"><span class="FootNote_footnote-content__r2OVl"><span id="48eac589-9446-4e42-b3df-8d45bad69ab7" aria-hidden="true" data-module-theme="light" class="FootNote_footnote-text__VjKgO mck-u-links-inline">Falendra Kumar Sudan, <em>Leveraging the participation of small and medium-sized enterprises in global value chains of the automotive Industry: Insights from Maruti Suzuki India Limited</em>, ADBI working paper number 1167, Asian Development Bank Institute, July 2020.</span></span></span></a></span> Nestlé’s Nescafe Plan has provided training to small coffee farmers for techniques to increase crop yields.<span class="FootNote_footnote-holder__tjRqy"><a aria-label="footnote" href="javascript:void(0);" class="FootNote_footnote-wrapper__AIRwL undefined FootNote_inactive__VZfCp" aria-describedby="ddbbbd02-4a42-4e86-a25b-c77ef50191af"><sup class="FootNote_footnotesup__e73z_">72</sup><span class="FootNote_notch-wrapper__b_5NS"><span class="FootNote_notch__omKtY"></span></span><span class="FootNote_tooltip__QtrbA mdc-u-mt-2"><span class="FootNote_footnote-content__r2OVl"><span id="ddbbbd02-4a42-4e86-a25b-c77ef50191af" aria-hidden="true" data-module-theme="light" class="FootNote_footnote-text__VjKgO mck-u-links-inline">Mark Segal, “Nestle commits over
    $1 billion to sustainable coffee farming plan,” <em>ESG Today</em>,
    October 4, 2022.</span></span></span></a></span></li>
    <li><em>Conferring MSME partners with an ability to build workforce capabilities. </em>One example is Apple, which launched a $50 million fund in collaboration with the International Labour Organization and the International Organization for Migration to provide learning and skills development opportunities for the employees of its suppliers.<span class="FootNote_footnote-holder__tjRqy"><a aria-label="footnote" href="javascript:void(0);" class="FootNote_footnote-wrapper__AIRwL undefined FootNote_inactive__VZfCp" aria-describedby="79c0ad3b-35f5-4f41-8836-1eb75d3f73dc"><sup class="FootNote_footnotesup__e73z_">73</sup><span class="FootNote_notch-wrapper__b_5NS"><span class="FootNote_notch__omKtY"></span></span><span class="FootNote_tooltip__QtrbA mdc-u-mt-2"><span class="FootNote_footnote-content__r2OVl"><span id="79c0ad3b-35f5-4f41-8836-1eb75d3f73dc" aria-hidden="true" data-module-theme="light" class="FootNote_footnote-text__VjKgO mck-u-links-inline">“Apple launches $50 million Supplier Employee Development Fund,” Apple, March 30, 2022.</span></span></span></a></span> In India, Walmart launched a Supplier Development Program to train and prepare 50,000 small businesses to better integrate into global supply chains.<span class="FootNote_footnote-holder__tjRqy"><a aria-label="footnote" href="javascript:void(0);" class="FootNote_footnote-wrapper__AIRwL undefined FootNote_inactive__VZfCp" aria-describedby="4c1353d6-6165-478c-95cd-30808b5fb4b8"><sup class="FootNote_footnotesup__e73z_">74</sup><span class="FootNote_notch-wrapper__b_5NS"><span class="FootNote_notch__omKtY"></span></span><span class="FootNote_tooltip__QtrbA mdc-u-mt-2"><span class="FootNote_footnote-content__r2OVl"><span id="4c1353d6-6165-478c-95cd-30808b5fb4b8" aria-hidden="true" data-module-theme="light" class="FootNote_footnote-text__VjKgO mck-u-links-inline">“Walmart empowers MSMEs
    to accelerate growth and
    access new markets,” Walmart, December 9, 2019.</span></span></span></a></span></li>
    <li><em>Lending weight to the reputation of MSMEs when requesting finance. </em>For example, DuPont leveraged its relationship with a financial institution to secure working capital credit for its MSME suppliers in rural areas, thereby strengthening its supply chain and increasing sales.<span class="FootNote_footnote-holder__tjRqy"><a aria-label="footnote" href="javascript:void(0);" class="FootNote_footnote-wrapper__AIRwL undefined FootNote_inactive__VZfCp" aria-describedby="012f64fc-21d9-4ecf-a190-c4b2918f337d"><sup class="FootNote_footnotesup__e73z_">75</sup><span class="FootNote_notch-wrapper__b_5NS"><span class="FootNote_notch__omKtY"></span></span><span class="FootNote_tooltip__QtrbA mdc-u-mt-2"><span class="FootNote_footnote-content__r2OVl"><span id="012f64fc-21d9-4ecf-a190-c4b2918f337d" aria-hidden="true" data-module-theme="light" class="FootNote_footnote-text__VjKgO mck-u-links-inline"><em>Partnerships for small enterprise development</em>, United Nations Industrial Development
    Organization, 2009.</span></span></span></a></span> Large financial institutions have a particularly important role in providing affordable credit and better product options to MSMEs. Innovative underwriting approaches that use alternative credit data can help; an Experian survey found that 70 percent of small businesses are willing to furnish additional financial information if it will improve the chances of loan approval or reduce borrowing rates.<span class="FootNote_footnote-holder__tjRqy"><a aria-label="footnote" href="javascript:void(0);" class="FootNote_footnote-wrapper__AIRwL undefined FootNote_inactive__VZfCp" aria-describedby="ee414bef-8fe1-40e4-8590-d155bc508358"><sup class="FootNote_footnotesup__e73z_">76</sup><span class="FootNote_notch-wrapper__b_5NS"><span class="FootNote_notch__omKtY"></span></span><span class="FootNote_tooltip__QtrbA mdc-u-mt-2"><span class="FootNote_footnote-content__r2OVl"><span id="ee414bef-8fe1-40e4-8590-d155bc508358" aria-hidden="true" data-module-theme="light" class="FootNote_footnote-text__VjKgO mck-u-links-inline">Stefani Wendel, <em>What is
    alternative credit data?</em>,
    Experian, September 2018.</span></span></span></a></span></li>
</ul>
<h4>MSMEs can collaborate with one another to achieve network efficiencies</h4>
<p>Collaboration among MSMEs can help build their capabilities. In Europe, for instance, 30 to 40 percent of SMEs do not belong to any formal network, but can still forge collaborations.<span class="FootNote_footnote-holder__tjRqy"><a aria-label="footnote" href="javascript:void(0);" class="FootNote_footnote-wrapper__AIRwL undefined FootNote_inactive__VZfCp" aria-describedby="15f31b80-6461-404c-8594-c2556f261fa1"><sup class="FootNote_footnotesup__e73z_">77</sup><span class="FootNote_notch-wrapper__b_5NS"><span class="FootNote_notch__omKtY"></span></span><span class="FootNote_tooltip__QtrbA mdc-u-mt-2"><span class="FootNote_footnote-content__r2OVl"><span id="15f31b80-6461-404c-8594-c2556f261fa1" aria-hidden="true" data-module-theme="light" class="FootNote_footnote-text__VjKgO mck-u-links-inline"><em>OECD SME and Entrepreneurship Outlook 2023</em>, OECD, June 2023; and Firouze Pourmand Hilmersson and Mikael Hilmersson, “Networking to accelerate the pace of SME innovations,” <em>Journal of Innovation and Knowledge</em>, volume 6, number 1, January–March 2021.</span></span></span></a></span> That collaboration can even be at the level of individual MSMEs. Innovative companies cooperate on business activities with other organizations more than those that are not innovative.<span class="FootNote_footnote-holder__tjRqy"><a aria-label="footnote" href="javascript:void(0);" class="FootNote_footnote-wrapper__AIRwL undefined FootNote_inactive__VZfCp" aria-describedby="3f05596b-ea8a-4cb8-bedc-8c5e3828bde1"><sup class="FootNote_footnotesup__e73z_">78</sup><span class="FootNote_notch-wrapper__b_5NS"><span class="FootNote_notch__omKtY"></span></span><span class="FootNote_tooltip__QtrbA mdc-u-mt-2"><span class="FootNote_footnote-content__r2OVl"><span id="3f05596b-ea8a-4cb8-bedc-8c5e3828bde1" aria-hidden="true" data-module-theme="light" class="FootNote_footnote-text__VjKgO mck-u-links-inline"><em>OECD SME and Entrepreneurship Outlook 2023</em>, OECD, June 2023.</span></span></span></a></span> One OECD study of SMEs operating in Association of Southeast Asian Nations economies found that they perform better when they are allied with large enterprises, but also when they strike partnerships with other MSMEs.<span class="FootNote_footnote-holder__tjRqy"><a aria-label="footnote" href="javascript:void(0);" class="FootNote_footnote-wrapper__AIRwL undefined FootNote_inactive__VZfCp" aria-describedby="c6fcfbc1-1657-4edb-8339-ef62454515ad"><sup class="FootNote_footnotesup__e73z_">79</sup><span class="FootNote_notch-wrapper__b_5NS"><span class="FootNote_notch__omKtY"></span></span><span class="FootNote_tooltip__QtrbA mdc-u-mt-2"><span class="FootNote_footnote-content__r2OVl"><span id="c6fcfbc1-1657-4edb-8339-ef62454515ad" aria-hidden="true" data-module-theme="light" class="FootNote_footnote-text__VjKgO mck-u-links-inline">“Productivity, technology and innovation,” in <em>SME Policy Index: ASEAN 2018: Boosting competitiveness and inclusive growth</em>, OECD, 2018.</span></span></span></a></span> Japan’s Small and Medium Enterprise Agency has shown that SMEs that have partnered with other small enterprises in order to implement technology solutions in their operations have 76 percent more sales per employee than those that haven’t taken this route.<span class="FootNote_footnote-holder__tjRqy"><a aria-label="footnote" href="javascript:void(0);" class="FootNote_footnote-wrapper__AIRwL undefined FootNote_inactive__VZfCp" aria-describedby="d1c15fdc-b90f-4ac4-820a-1b87a49ba3bc"><sup class="FootNote_footnotesup__e73z_">80</sup><span class="FootNote_notch-wrapper__b_5NS"><span class="FootNote_notch__omKtY"></span></span><span class="FootNote_tooltip__QtrbA mdc-u-mt-2"><span class="FootNote_footnote-content__r2OVl"><span id="d1c15fdc-b90f-4ac4-820a-1b87a49ba3bc" aria-hidden="true" data-module-theme="light" class="FootNote_footnote-text__VjKgO mck-u-links-inline"><em>White paper on small and medium enterprises in Japan</em>, National Association of Small and Medium Enterprise Promotion Organizations, 2018. </span></span></span></a></span> For example, a small sheet-metal processor in Japan wanted to incorporate in-house cloud computing into its operations and partnered with two other enterprises in the same sector, but with different specialties. Together, the three companies built a joint order reception system, which enables them to collaborate on a range of projects with the same clients. All three MSMEs improved the digital and management capabilities of their manufacturing operations.<span class="FootNote_footnote-holder__tjRqy"><a aria-label="footnote" href="javascript:void(0);" class="FootNote_footnote-wrapper__AIRwL undefined FootNote_inactive__VZfCp" aria-describedby="494084e4-cfa0-40e8-902d-1092e1f7ee8e"><sup class="FootNote_footnotesup__e73z_">81</sup><span class="FootNote_notch-wrapper__b_5NS"><span class="FootNote_notch__omKtY"></span></span><span class="FootNote_tooltip__QtrbA mdc-u-mt-2"><span class="FootNote_footnote-content__r2OVl"><span id="494084e4-cfa0-40e8-902d-1092e1f7ee8e" aria-hidden="true" data-module-theme="light" class="FootNote_footnote-text__VjKgO mck-u-links-inline"><em>White paper on small and medium enterprises in Japan</em>, National Association of Small and Medium Enterprise Promotion Organizations, 2018. </span></span></span></a></span></p>

<p>Broader MSME collaborations at the association or group level can help more small businesses raise productivity through knowledge sharing, mentoring, networking, and online platforms. The SME Finance Forum works with more than 240 active member institutions—financial institutions, technology companies, development finance institutions, and relevant large corporations—to facilitate resources to help MSMEs bridge their financial access gap.<span class="FootNote_footnote-holder__tjRqy"><a aria-label="footnote" href="javascript:void(0);" class="FootNote_footnote-wrapper__AIRwL undefined FootNote_inactive__VZfCp" aria-describedby="173e0318-4557-4521-a02b-d1e16eeb4295"><sup class="FootNote_footnotesup__e73z_">82</sup><span class="FootNote_notch-wrapper__b_5NS"><span class="FootNote_notch__omKtY"></span></span><span class="FootNote_tooltip__QtrbA mdc-u-mt-2"><span class="FootNote_footnote-content__r2OVl"><span id="173e0318-4557-4521-a02b-d1e16eeb4295" aria-hidden="true" data-module-theme="light" class="FootNote_footnote-text__VjKgO mck-u-links-inline">SME Finance Forum. </span></span></span></a></span> The DIGITAL SME Alliance in Europe launched a platform for traditional SMEs to access a catalog of digital solutions ranging from videoconferencing to AI modeling.<span class="FootNote_footnote-holder__tjRqy"><a aria-label="footnote" href="javascript:void(0);" class="FootNote_footnote-wrapper__AIRwL undefined FootNote_inactive__VZfCp" aria-describedby="5af97237-d71f-4cbe-aacf-795cfe0b5f6c"><sup class="FootNote_footnotesup__e73z_">83</sup><span class="FootNote_notch-wrapper__b_5NS"><span class="FootNote_notch__omKtY"></span></span><span class="FootNote_tooltip__QtrbA mdc-u-mt-2"><span class="FootNote_footnote-content__r2OVl"><span id="5af97237-d71f-4cbe-aacf-795cfe0b5f6c" aria-hidden="true" data-module-theme="light" class="FootNote_footnote-text__VjKgO mck-u-links-inline">OECD Digital for SMEs Global Initiative (D4SME), OECD, 2022.</span></span></span></a></span></p>
<p>Other companies can also facilitate the creation of such MSME networks. For example, IBM, in collaboration with other Fortune 500 companies, launched a Supplier Connection initiative that connects small suppliers to one another and to large businesses to access new opportunities.<span class="FootNote_footnote-holder__tjRqy"><a aria-label="footnote" href="javascript:void(0);" class="FootNote_footnote-wrapper__AIRwL undefined FootNote_inactive__VZfCp" aria-describedby="9ec18adf-d143-44e3-aee1-29811964f377"><sup class="FootNote_footnotesup__e73z_">84</sup><span class="FootNote_notch-wrapper__b_5NS"><span class="FootNote_notch__omKtY"></span></span><span class="FootNote_tooltip__QtrbA mdc-u-mt-2"><span class="FootNote_footnote-content__r2OVl"><span id="9ec18adf-d143-44e3-aee1-29811964f377" aria-hidden="true" data-module-theme="light" class="FootNote_footnote-text__VjKgO mck-u-links-inline">Freddie Pierce, “IBM launches
    new Supplier Connection portal,” <em>Supply Chain Digital</em>, May 17, 2020.</span></span></span></a></span> SABI, an African digital infrastructure provider, fosters connections between MSME merchants, wholesalers, distributors, and manufacturers. It also provides them with enterprise resource planning tools, B2B commerce interfaces, and financial services, enabling MSMEs to reach new customers, improve their cash flow, and streamline their logistics.<span class="FootNote_footnote-holder__tjRqy"><a aria-label="footnote" href="javascript:void(0);" class="FootNote_footnote-wrapper__AIRwL undefined FootNote_inactive__VZfCp" aria-describedby="3ad1810f-94f5-49bf-b0c4-da35005b019b"><sup class="FootNote_footnotesup__e73z_">85</sup><span class="FootNote_notch-wrapper__b_5NS"><span class="FootNote_notch__omKtY"></span></span><span class="FootNote_tooltip__QtrbA mdc-u-mt-2"><span class="FootNote_footnote-content__r2OVl"><span id="3ad1810f-94f5-49bf-b0c4-da35005b019b" aria-hidden="true" data-module-theme="light" class="FootNote_footnote-text__VjKgO mck-u-links-inline">Sabi.</span></span></span></a></span></p>
<hr>
<p>Raising productivity is, and always has been, the optimal route to healthier incomes and business resilience. In a world beset by uncertainty amid geopolitical tensions and shifts in manufacturing and services footprints, raising the game of the world’s MSMEs—which are so central to jobs, livelihoods, value creation, and economic growth—is a priority. The potential is large, but efforts to capture it need to be thoughtful and very likely targeted. Only by having a granular understanding of MSME productivity can effective action be taken. That action can create a win-win for all companies, small and large.</p>
